title: NeuroticFish
author: NeuroticFish
content: Since I've seen that everybody comes up "knowing better" what this forum may be needing, I'll try my shot too.I feel like the forum could use one more mod in the Dev&Tech sub. I have a feeling that the current mods, although highly technical, don't really have the time do "house cleaning".I know that in most of the cases there's not so much garbage there, I also know that global mods may look in there now and then, but lately I've noticed that at least this topic got derailed pretty bad and I guess that some "kicks" here and there would be useful.... or would somebody just take the patience and report a bunch of posts? Would be that enough?

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: It reminds me of @franky1 who have a different view on some topic discussion e.g. Lightning network, but I don't think those people who have different view about Bitcoin and have a point about what he's talking about should be kicked. I disagree with @nullius opinion, but his post shouldn't be deleted, just the whole drama posts only should be deleted. I will report some of the posts that I think only discuss about a drama or attacking each other without adding substantial value to the @OP.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Unfortunately every bitcointalk needs thread pretty much goes in 1 ear and out the other. Unless there are reports I would guess moderators leave the section alone honestly. So, yes someone reporting would be a big help for that section.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: The thread Op pointed to is a good one, started in a good fate, recieved good number of merits but was hijacked or derailed at the tail end. It is not peculiar to that topic on div board only, I have seen it happen in some threads and boards.In my opinion and if I were to be a moderator, I will not be so swift to lock a thread or delete posts in a such a thread. I will give time for every party to express their opinions and feelings before I would do what Achow101 did. I believe moderators most times deliberately allow things to play out in order to preserve liberty or freedom. Because if some arguments or trolls are interrupted, the aggrieved would find a way to re-start it in another thread thereby spreading the troll. It is therefore good to allow stirs exhaust and settle in the particular thread it originated from.If you grossly do not agree with someone's opinion, ignore them, but if you cannot, then tag them and maybe your matter would be brought to reputation to be judged, you may end up being removed from DT for trust abuse.

Well, it's like in all "bitcointalk needs" cases I guess I can lock this topic. Thank you all for the input.
